head.title: Despite Divorce, Children Need Both Parents

hedline.hl1: Despite Divorce, Children Need Both Parents

abstract.p: Elayne E Greenberg letter on October 1 article on fathers' rights holds children need and want both parents (S)

block.p: I read the article about an advocacy group for fathers' rights [''Shredding the Concept of 'Deadbeat Dads,' '' Long Island Journal, Oct. 1] and recoiled at another approach that reinforces the wedge between divorced parents. That is the antithesis of what divorced families need! In my experience as a divorced mother, stepmother, developer of family mediation programs and director of Queens Peace, a parent education program for divorcing parents, one message resounds: children need and want both parents. Our obligation as parents is to ensure that our child is able to have a meaningful relationship with both parents.

What divorced parent or second spouse can't flawlessly recite the serious failings of the ex who haunts her life? However, this exercise does little to help our children. I invite the leaders of Women for Fatherhood to redirect their energies and support the many initiatives that are helping families reorganize in a way that's best for their child.
